raw_text:
Wine comedy wins critics' award
 
 Quirky comedy Sideways was named the best film of the year by the Los Angeles Film Critics Association.
 
 The US movie also picked up four other accolades including best director for Alexander Payne and supporting actor for Thomas Haden Church. British actress Imelda Staunton has again been recognised for her role in Vera Drake, winning best actress, while Liam Neeson won best actor for Kinsey. The awards will be handed out on 13 January at a ceremony in Las Vegas.
 
 Sideways tells the story of two men who take a road trip through California's wine regions and also stars Paul Giamatti. Virginia Madsen was also named best supporting actress for her performance in the film. House of Flying Daggers, directed by Yimou Zhang, was named best foreign language film, while the animation award went to The Incredibles. Unusually, the runners-up in categories were also named with Clint Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby just missing out on the best film award. The best director runner-up was Martin Scorsese for The Aviator. A career achievement award will be handed to veteran actor and comic Jerry Lewis at the ceremony next year.
llama3.2:1b: Sideways wins Los Angeles Film Critics Association awards, including best director for Alexander Payne and Thomas Haden Church's supporting role in Kinsey.
llama3.2:3b: Sideways won the Los Angeles Film Critics Association award for best film, and its cast members won additional awards including Alexander Payne (best director), Thomas Haden Church (supporting actor), Imelda Staunton (best actress), Paul Giamatti, Virginia Madsen (best supporting actress), and Liam Neeson (best actor).
Other winners included House of Flying Daggers for best foreign language film and The Incredibles for animation.
Clint Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby was the runner-up in categories including best film, while Martin Scorsese came close to winning best director.
gemma2:2b: Sideways won the Los Angeles Film Critics Association's award for best film of the year.
It also received awards for best director (Alexander Payne), best supporting actor (Thomas Haden Church), and best supporting actress (Virginia Madsen).
Imelda Staunton won best actress for Vera Drake, while Liam Neeson won best actor for Kinsey.
The ceremony will be held in Las Vegas on January 13th.
House of Flying Daggers won the award for best foreign language film, while The Incredibles won the animation award.
Million Dollar Baby was a runner-up for the best film award, and Martin Scorsese was named the best director runner-up.
A career achievement award will be given to Jerry Lewis at the ceremony next year.

Imelda Staunton took Best Actress for Vera Drake, Liam Neeson Best Actor for Kinsey, Virginia Madsen was named Best Supporting Actress for Sideways, and Yimou Zhang's House of Flying Daggers won Best Foreign Language Film.
Clint Eastwood’s Million Dollar Baby placed second in the best film category.
Martin Scorsese received a runner-up award for Best Director for The Aviator.
A career achievement award will be given to Jerry Lewis at next year's ceremony.

The US film also receives four accolades: best actor for Liam Neeson in Kinsey, best actress for Imelda Staunton in Vera Drake, best supporting actress for Virginia Madsen, and best director.

tinyllama:1.1b: In the world of US cinema, Sideways has been crowned the best film of the year by the Los Angeles Film Critics Association.
The US comedy received several accolades including best director for Alexander Payne, supporting actor for Thomas Haden Church, and actress Imelda Stauby's role in Vera Drake.
The award ceremony will be held on 13 January in Las Vegas.
In addition, Sideways was also named best foreign language film, with Virginia Madsen receiving the best supporting actress prize.
House of Flying Daeggers and the animation award went to The Incredibles, while the runner-up in categories was Clint Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby.
However, Martin Scorsese failed to win a career achievement award at the ceremony next year.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Sideways, a witty comedy set in wine country of California, has won three major awards, including the top prize from the Los Angeles Film Critics Association (LAFCA).
The film earned four additional nominations for best director, best actor (Paul Giamatti), and best supporting actress (Virginia Madsen), as well as a special recognition by the LAFCA.

House of Flying Daggers, directed by acclaimed filmmaker Yimou Zhang, also took home three nominations: best foreign language film, best supporting actor for Jack O'Connell, and best editing for Tariq Hassan.

The runners-up in various categories were also recognized at the ceremony, with Clint Eastwood's film Million Dollar Baby nominated for best film and Martin Scorsese receiving the runner-up award for his work on The Incredibles.
A career achievement award will be given to veteran actor Jerry Lewis next year, as he celebrates a remarkable milestone in his career.
